title: Apogeo Space orders second space tug for connectivity constellation
summary: Apogeo Space, an Italian venture with plans for nearly 100 tiny satellites for connecting remote monitoring devices, said June 5 it had signed a deal to deploy nine picosatellites next year with an orbital transfer vehicle from Momentus.

title: Space Force opens new office to foster ties with private sector
summary: The Space Systems Command on June 6 opened a new office and conference center dedicated for doing business with the commercial space industry.

title: NASA Names Winners of 2023 Student Rocket Launch Competition
summary: NASA announced Tuesday the University of Alabama in Huntsville is the overall winner of the agency’s 2023 Student Launch challenge.

title: OneWeb targets maritime market with expanded satellite coverage
summary: TAMPA, Fla. — OneWeb launched a free trial offer for maritime customers June 6 after bringing its low Earth orbit broadband network online over a larger swathe of the northern hemisphere.

title: Webb unveils the secrets of the early universe via deep field, peers into stellar nurseries
summary: With help from the joint NASA/European Space Agency/Canadian Space Agency James Webb Space Telescope (JWST), scientists are peering deep into the universe and uncovering secrets that were previously hidden from visible and X-ray telescopes. The JWST advanced deep extragalactic survey (JADES) utilized Webb’s incredible deep-field surveying abilities to create a deep field that shows over 45,000 galaxies and uncovers some of the secrets of the early universe.

title: Evidence Mounting That Avio Intends to Split from Arianespace
summary: Avio CEO Giulio Ranzo told Wired that work being done on a reusable demonstrator may be a prelude to an entirely new product line for the company.

title: INTERVIEW: We Sit Down With RFA COO Stefan Brieschenk
summary: Rocket Factory Augsburg (RFA) is a new name in the spaceflight industry that you've probably heard a lot over the past few years. If you haven't, we've got you covered! Back in March, TLP was given the opportunity to have an interview with RFA's Chief Operating Officer and Co-Founder, Dr. Steffan Brieschenk, who talked to us about RFA's Background, engines, facilities, future and more.

title: With 7,000+ satellites and growing, is space sustainable? An Ars Frontiers recap
summary: "We've been using space as our own personal operating dumping ground."

title: Rivada seeks Ex-Im financing for satellite constellation
summary: Rivada Space Networks is hoping to secure support from the U.S. Ex-Im Bank to finance a multibillion-dollar satellite constellation whose future also depends on an impending decision by international regulators.

title: Nearly two decades after NASA, China and Europe eye commercial cargo plans
summary: Doing so, however, will be challenging.
